channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Entertainment
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2019 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: 'Jane the Virgin' closes the book with pitch-perfect finale
item.description: The following contains spoilers about the "Jane the Virgin" series finale.

item.title: 'Doctor Who' coming to HBO Max in 2020
item.description: HBO Max is hoping its latest library acquisition helps it "Exterminate!" some of its competition in the streaming wars.

item.title: Patrick Swayze remembered in 'I Am Patrick Swayze' trailer
item.description: The many shades of Patrick Swayze are revealed through interviews with his friends and co-stars in the upcoming documentary "I Am Patrick Swayze."

item.title: Eva Longoria says Felicity Huffman handled college cheating scandal with 'grace'
item.description: One of Felicity Huffman's former "Desperate Housewives" co-stars has some words of praise for her.

item.title: B.J. Novak parties with ex Mindy Kaling for his 40th birthday
item.description: B.J. Novak just turned 40. And the former co-star of "The Office" did it with ex-girlfriend Mindy Kaling by his side.

item.title: A$AP Rocky says he was scared during street brawl in assault trial testimony
item.description: American rapper A$AP Rocky testified that he was scared and acted in self-defense during a June street fight when he spoke on the second day of his assault trial in Sweden on Thursday, in a case being monitored from the courtroom by the President Donald Trump's special envoy for hostage affairs.

item.title: 'Hobbs & Shaw' races into new lane under 'Fast & Furious' flag
item.description: "Fast & Furious Presents: Hobbs & Shaw" is an awfully long-winded title for a movie with roughly the same plot as the 1989 squabbling buddy vehicle "Tango & Cash," only with bigger -- well, pretty much everything -- and better special effects.

item.title: Lizzo and the dichotomy of big girl praise
item.description: I'm not going to declare Lizzo the patron saint of big girls, as much as I want to.

item.title: Salma Hayek says Meghan Markle had some top-secret rules for that British Vogue cover
item.description: Salma Hayek was sitting in her car when she got the call. It was British Vogue editor Edward Enninful, a longtime friend of hers, asking if it was OK to patch in someone very special. Hayek was expecting their mutual friend Naomi Campbell to pop on the line.

item.title: Jordyn Woods reportedly hopes to work things out with Kylie Jenner
item.description: Jordyn Woods and Kylie Jenner had one of the most famous friendships in recent years and it sounds like Woods doesn't believe that it's over.

item.title: Dwayne Johnson is still trying to save a sacred Hawaiian volcano
item.description: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson has said he's not joining the 2020 race for the White House, but he still sounds like he'd be a great candidate.

item.title: Jerry Garcia remembered on posthumous birthday
item.description: There was a "Ripple" of birthday love for Jerry Garcia across social media Thursday.

item.title: Woodstock 50 festival canceled
item.description: The Woodstock 50 festival, which in its planning stages has been plagued by a series of misfortunes and obstacles, will not go on as planned.

item.title: Mario Lopez apologizes for 'ignorant' comments about parenting and gender identity
item.description: TV personality Mario Lopez has apologized for comments made during a recent podcast appearance in which he said it was "dangerous" for parents to allow their children to pick their gender identities at young ages.

item.title: 'Four Weddings and a Funeral' series drops the movie's bouquet
item.description: The hunger for titles that can knife through the six-layered cake of media clutter has led to a lot of bad ideas, few less inspired than appropriating "Four Weddings and a Funeral" a quarter-century later and turning it into a 12-episode series. Disconnected from the movie, it's basically just another means of creating a show about mixed-up Millennials, for richer and (mostly) poorer.

item.title: Harold Prince, the man who has won more Tony awards than anyone else, has died
item.description: Legendary Broadway producer and director, Harold Prince, who directed some of the most famous musicals ever made, including "West Side Story" and "The Phantom of the Opera" died on after a brief illness, in Reykjavik, Iceland, on Wednesday. He was 91.

item.title: 'The Irishman' trailer teases gangster epic
item.description: Netflix has revealed a two-minute trailer for Martin Scorsese's highly anticipated gangster epic, "The Irishman."

item.title: 'The Red Sea Diving Resort' showcases Michael Kenneth Williams and Chris Evans
item.description: Not all heroes wear spandex, and Chris Evans -- fresh off his run as Captain America -- plays a more down-to-earth champion of justice in "The Red Sea Diving Resort," an earnest but mediocre movie washing ashore on Netflix.

item.title: New friends Demi Lovato and 'Bachelorette' Hannah Brown bond over windmill cookies
item.description: Who needs a fiancé when you've got Demi Lovato loving on you?

item.title: Stephen Colbert used 'Scooby-Doo' to explain the Democratic debates
item.description: Stephen Colbert compared the field of Democratics running for president to an episode of "Scooby-Doo."

item.title: 'Bachelorette' finale shocker was definitely a game of love
item.description: Tuesday's season finale of ABC's "The Bachelorette" fulfilled its promise both to devoted Bachelor Nation fans who'd riot if this chapter didn't include a diamond ring and talk of nuptials and to the hate-watchers who argue that orchestrated, made-for-television romance is not real.

item.title: We are one step closer to a 'Zoey 101' reunion
item.description: The universe must know how badly we need a "Zoey 101" reunion.

item.title: Katy Perry's 'Dark Horse' is just music's latest copyright battle
item.description: We've heard this tune before.

item.title: Mayim Bialik shares powerful moment against hate
item.description: Mayim Bialik and her young sons had a "powerful moment of unity and understanding" recently on the New York City subway.

item.title: 'Orange is the New Black' final season finds urgency and purpose in ICE plot
item.description: "Orange is the New Black" and "House of Cards" helped put Netflix on the map, establishing the service as an original programming force. The prison drama, however, has stumbled in the latter half of its run, as it heads into a final season elevated and given a sense of urgency and purpose by a timely hook involving immigration and detention.

item.title: 'Once Upon a Time ... in Hollywood' is Quentin Tarantino's valentine to the era
item.description: Quentin Tarantino's passion for old Hollywood finds an interesting outlet of expression in "Once Upon a Time ... in Hollywood," a movie that combines nostalgia, quirkiness and showy star performances while again weaving together fictional characters with actual ones.

item.title: See what's streaming in August
item.description: Oh August, we have such mixed emotions about you.

item.title: 'The Brady Bunch' cast talks about remodeling their TV home
item.description: It turns out that, for the surviving cast members of "The Brady Bunch," you can go home again. Even if you never actually lived there.

item.title: How Tarantino's 'Once Upon a Time ... in Hollywood' traveled back to 1969
item.description: For Quentin Tarantino, time travel is entirely possible. And it didn't take green screens or computer generated backdrops to make it back to 1969-era Los Angeles. All it required were fond, vivid memories of the time, an exhausting attention to period detail and a production designer like Barbara Ling.

item.title: Kim Kardashian West, Esq. in 2022? You better believe it
item.description: It's a sunny Saturday afternoon in Los Angeles and Kim Kardashian West is sitting in a conference room of a law office, blinds drawn, surrounded by law books, an array of highlighters, pens, binders and notebooks filled with her handwritten notes. On the other end of a sprawling conference room table are a pile of letters addressed to West from inmates who are hoping she will take interest in their case in an attempt to have their life sentences commuted. It's in this quiet room, removed from the distractions that come with being one of the most famous women in the world, that Kardashian West meets once a week with two attorneys who are helping her prepare for the California state bar exam.
